Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What sustainable or environmental practices have been implemented?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: Throughout its operations, Flowers for Dreams has demonstrated a commitment to sustainability and environmental stewardship. They recycle flowers and deliver them to healthcare facilities near and far, providing healing experiences for patients and reducing waste. Additionally, they support initiatives focused on urban agriculture, community empowerment, economic development, and inspired healthy eating. These efforts contribute to creating a more environmentally conscious and sustainable future for the communities they serve.

source.content: Education Standards with national stakeholders This month Flowers for Dreams is supporting our vision to provide food education to every child in every school I am currently working at Teens Grow Greens in Milwaukee What drew me to Teens Grow Greens was their overall goal To impact the community by first educating the youth I have always wanted to make a change in my community and this program gave me a chance to take part in activities such as gardening and community service which I have always seen as a hobby to better serve my community The nine-month internship gave me the opportunity to be able to grow as an individual by working with teens with the same mission and by enhancing my leadership  responsibility skills–all while doing things I enjoy By being educated on issues within my community I get a better understanding what exactly it is that I can do to help make an impact in my community The most important thing that I have learned so far at my time at Teens Grow Greens would

I get a better understanding what exactly it is that I can do to help make an impact in my community The most important thing that I have learned so far at my time at Teens Grow Greens would have to be about the issue of food deserts within my community Nearly half of the people who live in food deserts are low-income families Coming from a low-income family myself and learning that most food deserts are in communities like mine forced me to acknowledge the food deserts located within my own community I never questioned why corner stores and fast food stores were more convenient than grocery stores Only after becoming an intern at Teens Grow Greens did I ever question this fact After the unit on healthy living food deserts and food injustices my eyes finally opened and I could see the pattern between health-related issues and regions where food deserts were most common Learning about food security was essential for me because I am now better educated about the reasoning behind the

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: Are there any events or initiatives focused on environmental conservation? If yet then list 10 such events.
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result:
Yes, there are various events and initiatives focused on environmental conservation. However, listing all of them would not be feasible in this format. Instead, I can provide you with some examples of notable events and organizations related to environmental conservation:

1. Earth Day (April 2nd) - A global event promoting awareness and action for environmental protection.
2. World Environment Day (June 5th) - Organized by the United Nations, this day encourages worldwide attention and action for the environment.
3. Global Climate Strike (September 20-27, 219) - A series of protests demanding action on climate change.
4. National Park Service - An agency within the U.S. Department of the Interior that manages and preserves national parks and other public lands.
5. The Nature Conservancy - A nonprofit organization dedicated to conserving land and water resources across the globe.
6. WWF (World Wildlife Fund) - A leading international organization committed to stopping the degradation of the planet's natural environment.
7. Sierra Club - America's largest and most influential grassroots environmental organization.
8. Audubon Society - A network of organizations dedicated to conserving and protecting natural habitats for birds and other wildlife.
9. Ocean Conservancy - Advocating for ocean conservation policies and actions to address issues like plastic pollution and overfishing.
10. Conservation International - A nonprofit organization focused on ensuring the abundance of nature for people today and

residents a relief and aquatic experience with the first inland collection of freshwater and marine animals Earlier this month we introduced our charity of the month An organization that pairs students from underserved communities with inspiring members Spark does so during a valuable and significant age in their lives The start of August anticipates the start of a new school year and coincidentally marks the beginning of an exciting partnership with a charity that empowers youth to succeed We joined Random Acts of Flowers volunteers at Presence Saint Mary and Elizabeth Medical Center in West Town just down the street from our Flowers for Dreams studio  Random Acts of Flowers is a non-profit that creates beautiful bouquets from recycled and repurposed flowers to deliver to patients in healthcare facilities We recently had the opportunity to head down to Englewood bouquets in hand of course to get a first-hand look inside our June Charity Growing Home who will benefit from every

We’re proud to introduce our charity partner for the month of September Freshwater Future Their mission is to improve all aspects of our Great Lakes’ ecosystem; from providing clean drinking water sustaining a healthy fishing system and maintaining clean beaches Freshwater Future is on the path to elongating a healthy future of the Great Lakes region Freshwater Future sees itself as a collaborative organization where they work to build effective communities by listening to diverse groups’ opinions appointing advocates and working amongst Chicago’s residents This unique approach of involving residents in the decision making create one effective working unit within a community with a common goal of restoring our waters from toxic pollution destroyed habitats and other major threats There’s still time to enjoy the lake and beach as Summer comes to a close and you can thank the folks at Freshwater Future for keeping those regions clean

April calls for a change in seasons where the snow melts away and flowers begin to bloom With the excuse of Earth Day and Arbor Day we decided to pay homage to Mother Nature this month by donating a quarter of our profits to Chicago Gateway Green a non-profit that specializes in keeping Chicago clean and beautiful With roots dating back to  Gateway Green has strived to beautify Chicago’s expressways and neighborhoods Through planting tens of thousands of plants and trees as well as removing 12 million pounds of litter Gateway Green has become a major player of keeping the city beautiful and bringing communities together Gateway Green hosts several events throughout the year to inspire locals to help beautify their city One of these events falls on Arbor Day where Gateway Green leads a neighborhood beautification project; community members join together and plant trees in their local neighborhoods For the entire month of April a quarter of our profits go towards a “Day of Impact”

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What environmental impact metrics are reported?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: In the given text, there isn't any specific mention of environmental impact metrics related to the mentioned organizations or initiatives. However, some general information about the organizations can still be inferred from the text. For example, Chicago Gateway Green focuses on greening and beautifying the city's expressways and neighborhoods through various projects like tree planting and litter removal. These efforts contribute to cleaner air, reduced stormwater runoff, increased biodiversity, and improved quality of life for residents. Similarly, Teens Grow Greens in Milwaukee works on educational programs related to food and gardening, promoting sustainable practices and fostering a connection between people and the environment. Overall, although no specific environmental impact metrics are explicitly stated, it can be assumed that both organizations play a role in positively impacting the environment and contributing to a greener, more sustainable urban landscape.

was fortunate enough to be selected as one of Flowers for Dreams’  Charity Partners Their team is the real deal and their impact extends well beyond a check to charity They don’t just partner with nonprofits to check a box or keep up appearances; they’re truly invested in the long-term success and mission of each nonprofit they support Their dedication to service is evident in every aspect of their company and culture From volunteering to host a floral arrangement workshop for our participants with disabilities to driving their flower truck over an hour to the western suburbs to support our summer fundraiser their team exceeded all expectations They went out of their way to ensure each of the kids and adults with disabilities they interacted with felt seen known and valued You simply cannot put a dollar amount to that kind of impact Flowers for Dreams was also instrumental in helping us spread awareness of our mission of inclusion Not only did our partnership help grow Aspire’s brand

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Has the organization made any public commitments to social or corporate responsibility?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Yes, based on the provided information, it appears that Flowers for Dreams has made public commitments to social and corporate responsibility. The organization donates 25% of its profits to various causes through their foundation, which covers several states across the Midwest region. Additionally, Flowers for Dreams has been involved in community initiatives such as volunteering for river cleanups, hosting floral arrangement workshops for people with disabilities, supporting a school focused on integrating health and balance into their curriculum, and partnering with nonprofit organizations like Pits for Patriots and Flowers for Dreams Foundation. These actions demonstrate a strong commitment to giving back to the communities they serve and promoting positive change.

Commerce & Products.question: Are there any promotional events, expos, or sales for these offerings? If yes, list them.
Commerce & Products.result:
Yes, there are several promotional events, expos, and sales related to these offerings. Here's a list of some notable ones:

1. NoEmptyBackpacks Drive (Flowers for Dreams): This is an ongoing campaign where individuals can donate school supplies to benefit schools in need. There is currently less than a month remaining until the end of the drive.
2. Weddings by Flowers for Dreams: Although not explicitly mentioned in the text, it can be assumed that Flowers for Dreams hosts various promotions and discounts for couples planning their weddings. These could include special offers for booking early, limited-time deals on specific floral arrangements, or package discounts for choosing certain services. However, specific details regarding these promotions may vary depending on the current marketing strategies employed by Flowers for Dreams.

Commerce & Products.question: What are the key partnerships or collaborations related to commerce?
Commerce & Products.result: The key partnership or collaboration mentioned in the text is between Accion and its partners. They work together to "level the playing field" and provide opportunities and resources for overlooked small businesses in various neighborhoods across Chicago. By offering financial assistance and support, Accion helps these businesses grow and create jobs within their communities.

source.content: who help build the businesses and generate the jobs in their communities From the neighborhood barbershop that employs ten to the local nail salon that has served the community for 30 years and many small  neighborhood shops in between Accion and it’s partners exist to help level the playing field and increase opportunity  access for overlooked small businesses Throughout the month of November every Flowers for Dreams bouquet will support Accion Chicago and their job-creating efforts in Back of the Yards Austin Pilsen North Lawndale and many more neighborhoods throughout our great city We’ll be sharing the stories of three local business owners who started with little and overcame many odds to create meaningful jobs in their communities and successful companies in the Chicago area – all with Accion’s help and capital support From a nail salon on the city’s far south side to a popular cafe in west Pilsen to a now Zagat-rated restaurant in Uptown each of these establishments are success

Employment & Opportunities.question: What employment or educational opportunities are currently available?
Employment & Opportunities.result: There are several employment and educational opportunities mentioned in the text. For young people, there are tutoring and coaching positions available through organizations like One Million Degrees (OMD) and Spark. These programs provide academic support and guidance to help students succeed in school and beyond. Additionally, OMD offers associates degrees, which serve as a stepping stone towards economic mobility. Through its partnerships with various institutions, the City of Chicago is also expanding tuition-free degree programs for special needs students and high-achieving CPS students. This initiative aims to increase accessibility to higher education and create greater career opportunities for those who may not have had the chance otherwise. Furthermore, OMD connects scholars with mentors and provides internship opportunities to help bridge the achievement gap in Milwaukee's low-income neighborhoods. Lastly, apprenticeships at renowned companies like Google and Tyson Foods offer Chicago's underserved youth the opportunity to excel in various fields and discover their strengths and capabilities.

source.content: the program Lisa and the other staff work with them to secure a job that will help them continue to grow all of the skills they’ve learned thus far Continuing to support the success in our youth is just one of the many ways we can help them to establish a successful future It’s an honor to be associated with companies that want to invest in our younger generation and their future

help them succeed in school in work and in life From tutors and coaches to financial assistance and professional development OMD has offered critical support services to thousands of Chicago students in their 11 years The  class of OMD Scholars is over  – their biggest ever – and expects to again graduate twice the state average nearly 70 with the skills and experiences necessary to launch economically mobile careers Associates degrees are an important ticket to mobility The City of Chicago with OMD’s partnership is leading an effort to make them more accessible than in any other major city in the country helping launch degree programs for special needs students providing tuition-free education for high achieving CPS students and much more We’re grateful to be able to support One Million Degrees with every October bouquet We believe everyone deserves access to higher education and greater career opportunities and with your help OMD can continue working hard to make this a reality for

as music mixing video editing application development coding designing healthy food preparation robotics and more In addition the program links students to mentors and provides internships that will further help to bridge the alarming achievement gap that is growing in Milwaukee’s low-income neighborhoods Thank you Flowers for Dreams

Employment & Opportunities.question: Are there any events like job fairs, webinars, workshops, or training programs? If yes, list them.
Employment & Opportunities.result: Yes, there are various events offered by the mentioned organizations and institutions. For example, Secure Futures of West Town Milwaukee provides financial literacy programs and resources, including virtual programs. The Robotics League offers competitions and financial literacy training. Additionally, Center on Halsted in Chicago hosts sports leagues in their gymnasium and offers professional training services. These events cater to different aspects such as career development, personal finance, and skill building.

Employment & Opportunities.result:
The provided text mentions various benefits that employees or participants might receive from these organizations. Some of these benefits include:

1. Career development programs (Lisa Program)
2. Financial literacy programs (Advancing Childhood Health & Wellness in Michigan)
3. Positive resources and a community of support (Downtown Boxing Gym)
4. Non-judgmental crisis intervention counseling, individual and group trauma therapy, and medical and legal advocacy (The Center for Rape Victims Advocacy)

7. Weddings and vow renewals for couples facing serious illness or a life-altering circumstance (Cancer Care Inc.)

9. Literacy and lifelong learning support (Chicago Public Library)
10. Accessible AIDS-related healthcare and support services (AIDS Foundation of Chicago)

source.content: I get a better understanding what exactly it is that I can do to help make an impact in my community The most important thing that I have learned so far at my time at Teens Grow Greens would have to be about the issue of food deserts within my community Nearly half of the people who live in food deserts are low-income families Coming from a low-income family myself and learning that most food deserts are in communities like mine forced me to acknowledge the food deserts located within my own community I never questioned why corner stores and fast food stores were more convenient than grocery stores Only after becoming an intern at Teens Grow Greens did I ever question this fact After the unit on healthy living food deserts and food injustices my eyes finally opened and I could see the pattern between health-related issues and regions where food deserts were most common Learning about food security was essential for me because I am now better educated about the reasoning behind the

was our best year yet From growing our customer base our team quadrupling in size and hitting the K total donated milestone we couldn’t be more proud The end of the year called for giving ourselves a small pat on the back tallying up stats reflecting on the year and planning  After getting in touch with the Chicago non-profits we’ve donated to we wanted to take a moment to highlight where some of our donations went and how they have helped Kristen Faiferlick of Moneythink said that our donation in  “helped build out new features in [their] award-winning mobile app” and actually helped to fund the most largely attended Summer Leadership Institute they’ve ever hosted Here the organization brought in college volunteers to “train equip and inspire them to have a bigger impact in the  school year” to educate underserved youth on the ways to save and spend wisely This is an organization taking one topic that has fallen so low on the totem pole of education that it needs an

that our donations help to send their students to the top-rated high schools of the area This might seem like an overstatement but Namaste Charter School relies on donations to continue the immense strides they’ve made in transforming an otherwise standard brick building into what feels like a magical Willy Wonka-esque bubble where education feels so tangible Attainable Exciting While walking through their school this fall our usually-social team fell silent We were so impressed and astounded by the work the school is doing to integrate all meanings of  ‘health’ and ‘balance’ into their daily schedule Yoga meditation family style meals and organic foods being implemented into this Southwest Side school are just to name a few Our February charity was One Tail at A Time a dog rescue shelter near Bucktown Executive Director Heather Owen thanked us recently for the “long way” our donations went in  in the launching of their new adoption center allowing them to take in more dogs in need

goal posts from public health officials it became clear us vendors were being asked to police our own clients To enforce  regulate public health actions It was a recipe for failure We decided we needed to take this into our own hands We couldn’t be dragged into a “super-spreading” event or watch one of our employees test positive with too nice and flexible policies skirted by others We’ve been lucky  cautious so far but we needed to be a forceful leader for those who look to us So the last three weeks we deliberated as an executive team then with our entire team inviting many suggestions on how we could evolve our COVID-19 policy to set the highest safety standard in the industry without stopping  events altogether We exhausted what we felt was every reasonable option to balance the two and came to only one conclusion We cannot do them while ensuring the health  safety of our team If we wanted to walk the walk as a good corporate citizen own our leadership role as among the first B

Research & Innovation.question: What are the latest publications, research findings, or introduced technologies?
Research & Innovation.result: The information provided does not mention any specific recent publications, research findings, or introduced technologies related to Discovery World, its Reiman Aquarium, or the all-female aquarist team. However, we do learn about some initiatives and partnerships that involve the organization, including efforts to raise awareness and funding for breast cancer research through the Lynn Sage Foundation. Additionally, there are mentions of various programs and resources offered by Discovery World, such as those focused on technology, freshwater sciences, and STEM education, as well as opportunities for teen engagement and skill development.

source.content: Discovery World is Milwaukee’s premier non-profit science and technology center for the whole family Their  sq ft center offers fun and educational experiences and features interactive exhibits the Reiman Aquarium educational labs and programs and other exciting activities Unique hands-on exhibits and programs focus on two areas — technology and freshwater sciences — with eight learning labs that alone comprise of more than 10 sq ft of space With a mission to light the spark of curiosity in kids Discovery World wants to inspire them to become the next generation of engineers designers scientists innovators community leaders and makers What’s better than spending your day with turtles and fish How about introducing Milwaukee’s youth to turtles and fish and creating the next generation of Great Lakes stewards Meet Hilary Mueller one of the amazing curators inside Discovery World’s Reiman Aquarium Hilary is one member of an all-female aquarist team currently making waves in southeastern

Lakes stewards Meet Hilary Mueller one of the amazing curators inside Discovery World’s Reiman Aquarium Hilary is one member of an all-female aquarist team currently making waves in southeastern Wisconsin Visitors to the Reiman Aquarium can often see Hilary caring for animals scuba diving and cleaning the tanks and introducing students to the wonders of STEM education One of the most important ways to help young girls become immersed in STEM education is by connecting them with a role model with whom they can relate Enter Discovery World superstar Meghan Langmyer On any given day you can find Meghan teaching one of our awesome Fashion Design summer camps collecting trash from Milwaukee’s lakefront and turning it into inspiring invasive species artwork or simply finding yet another way to make science technology engineering and math look cool   25 of Milwaukee profits in January  support Discovery World Send a bouquet anywhere in the city at flowersfordreamscom

For the entire month of May a quarter of our profits are going toward the Lynn Sage Foundation and their mission to find a cure for breast cancer In  Laura and Halee founded the Lynn Sage Foundation in memory of their mother Lynn who died at 39 from her battle with breast cancer Since then the two sisters have been dedicated to finding a cure for this very serious disease that effects the lives of so many Every year LSF raises over  to the Lynn Sage Scholarship program where top researchers in the field are granted the funds to find a cure Currently Dr Athanassios Vassilopoulos is the featured scholar who is leading the way of research of tumor cell resistance

women with self-development tools guidance and support to strive for better and brighter futures Milwaukee Public Library Foundation has been grateful to partner with Flowers for Dreams in  Generous support from you and your customers underwrites innovation at the library like Teen Connected Learning led by Teen Intern peers who are using technology to spark high-quality experiential learning programming that builds leadership job skills social and emotional maturity creativity and critical thinking abilities Teens utilize a state-of-the-art flexible space in the new Mitchell Street library which includes a recording studio editing bays 3-D printer full kitchen art supplies coding and gaming equipment They are actively producing creating and experiencing innovative hands-on activities such as music mixing video editing application development coding designing healthy food preparation robotics and more In addition the program links students to mentors and provides internships that will

Research & Innovation.question: Are there any ongoing or upcoming research projects or innovation initiatives? If yes then list them
Research & Innovation.result:
Based on the provided information, it seems like there are several ongoing research projects and innovation initiatives related to various causes and organizations mentioned. However, specific details about these projects were not provided. Some possible examples could include:

1. Dr. Athanassios Vassilopoulos's research on tumor cell resistance through the Lynn Sage Foundation.
2. The SPARK program's focus on youth development through arts, performance, and cultivating the power of plants.
3. Organizations fighting against diseases like triple negative breast cancer, leukemia, lymphoma, Hodgkin's disease, myeloma, and addressing issues faced by LGBTQ+ individuals and underserved populations.
4. Programs focused on urban gardening, nutrition education, and job training for homeless or at-risk young people.
5. Efforts aimed at breaking the cycle of poverty among young mothers and their children.
6. Initiatives funding the continued education and experiences in Chicago's historic conservatory.
7. Community empowerment and economic development programs.

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: Are there any joint events, projects, or initiatives? If yes then list them.
Collaboration & Partnerships.result:
Yes, there are several joint events, projects, and initiatives mentioned in the text. Here's a list of some of them:

1. Volunteer cleanups at the Chicago River and Milwaukee Commons - Joint event involving community members coming together to improve local waterways.
2. Job training for women - Collaborative project aimed at empowering women through skill development and employment opportunities.
3. Employee placement for 3 years - Long-term initiative connecting employees with participating organizations for sustained impact.
4. Funding training at Milwaukee's Troop Cafe - Supportive partnership between organizations, ensuring the cafe can provide valuable training experiences.
5. Participation in Pits for Patriots with PTSD - Joint effort to assist veterans experiencing post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) by providing trained service dogs.
6. Donations to Flowers for Dreams Foundation - Contributions made by the company to support various charitable causes, including those listed above.

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What are the mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result:
Through these collaborations, there are several mutual objectives and outcomes expected. These include:

1. Cross-City Network: Connection, collaboration, and community leadership to promote equitable access to resources and shared decision-making.
2. Pets Helping People: Delivering pet therapy visits and enhancing human-animal bonding while also supporting mental health and wellbeing.
3. Leading Volunteer Health Organization (Alzheimer's Disease): Improving Alzheimer's care services and increasing awareness across southeastern Wisconsin counties.
4. Arts Internships Program: Developing career skills and fostering creativity among teenagers in Milwaukee.
5. Exceptional Music Education Program: Offering inclusive and accessible music education to empower individuals of various backgrounds.
6. Community Embracing Disabilities: Fostering an environment that supports, celebrates, and empowers people with diverse abilities.
7. College Success Program: Assisting low-income students in securing jobs related to their field of study, thereby helping them continue growing their skills.
8. Moneythink: Achieving core outcomes such as increased financial literacy, more informed financial decision-making, and greater overall financial wellbeing for young people.
9. Environment Supporting Arts Learning: Encouraging the creation of art-rich environments that facilitate learning and personal growth.
10. Storytelling Platform: Empowering individuals of all ages to share their unique stories, fostering empathy and understanding among community members.
11. Animal Welfare Services: Ensuring proper medical, behavioral, and physical support for animals regardless of age, health, or breed.
12. Breast Cancer Support: Providing emotional support and resources for individuals impacted by breast cancer.
13. Down Syndrome Career Development: Advocating for and implementing educational and therapeutic-based career development programs for individuals with Down syndrome.
14. HIV Support Services: Offering comprehensive, integrated, prevention, care, and treatment programs for individuals affected by HIV, along with respectful, caring partnership.
15. Financial Literacy Programs: Empowering students to make sound financial decisions through the provision of resources and educational initiatives.

These organizations and programs have come together with a shared goal of improving the quality of life for individuals and communities in various aspects, including education, healthcare, animal welfare, and social support.
